instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015: Charging IC blowing repeatedly
threads.message:
Hi,

The MLB was dead and there was no light on the MagSafe. 
- No visible corrosion on the MLB. Found charging IC faulty.
- After replacement, it worked for a while and the charging IC blew again
- Tried with another IC, same.

Please help me with the next steps.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A MBP <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2015: Charging IC blowing repeatedly
threads.message:
Was the machine working properly after <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> replacement?
Was the battery charging?
Did you check <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage without battery?
